page.title: 02Shops and Facilities.
page.content: The majority of shops in {Bruton } are based around the Hight Street, which also includes two pubs, two resturants, a take-away food shop, an art gallery and a number of private houses. All the shops and houses have long gardens, some of them stretching down to the Lower Backway and the river Brue, and others going towards Higher Backway. Bruton has its own Post Office and branch of the National Westminster Bank. There are three hairdressers, a material and craft shop, two electrical shops, as well as a clothes shop (incorporating a tea room) and an outfitters. Bruton is also a centre for antiques and old prints and books. There is a chemist, a dentist and a doctor's surgery, and a library, which opens on a part-time basis. Many of the shops were originally private houses.
